advertisement%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%3Cp%3ENine%20years%20ago%2C%20two%20C.I.A.%20officers%20walked%20into%20an%20Iraqi%20prison%20and%20saw%20a%20hallway%20filled%20with%20hooded%20men%2C%20about%20to%20be%20executed%20for%20supposed%20affiliation%20with%20Al%20Qaeda%20in%20Iraq%2C%20the%20group%20that%20gave%20birth%20to%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E.%20%E2%80%9CWe%20were%20hammering%20A.Q.I.%2C%20but%20the%20Iraqi%20government%20was%20just%20rounding%20up%20Sunnis%2C%E2%80%9D%20one%20of%20the%20C.I.A.%20officers%20recalled.%20%E2%80%9CAnd%2C%20for%20a%20moment%2C%20it%20worked.%E2%80%9D%20But%2C%20instead%20of%20releasing%20the%20innocents%2C%20the%20Iraqi%20government%20sentenced%20them%20to%20death.%20%E2%80%9CSo%2C%20of%20course%2C%20they%20came%20back%2C%E2%80%9D%20the%20officer%20said%2C%20of%20Al%20Qaeda%20in%20Iraq.%20%E2%80%9CWhat%20do%20you%20expect%3F%20You%20literally%20killed%20their%20dads.%E2%80%9D%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EIraq%20is%20now%20entering%20one%20of%20the%20most%20delicate%20moments%20in%20its%20recent%20history.%20To%20the%20extent%20that%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20functioned%20as%20a%20state%2C%20it%20was%20entirely%20predatory.%20But%2C%20by%20having%20lost%20on%20the%20battlefield%20rather%20than%20being%20toppled%20by%20its%20own%20depravity%2C%20the%20caliphate%20lives%20on%20as%20a%20fantasy%20of%20Islamic%20justice%20and%20governance%20which%20is%20measured%20against%20the%20corrupt%20reality%20of%20the%20Iraqi%20state.%20What%20is%20at%20stake%2C%20in%20this%20post-conflict%20period%2C%20is%20whether%20the%20Iraqi%20government%20can%20win%20over%20the%20segment%20of%20the%20population%20for%20whom%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20seemed%20a%20viable%20alternative.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%22%7D","ref":""},["p","The Islamic State has been mostly destroyed on the battlefield, but the war is far from over. Air strikes cannot kill an idea, and so it has fallen to Iraq’s fractured security, intelligence, and justice systems to try to finish the task. But, insofar as there is a strategy, it seems almost perfectly crafted to bring about the opposite of its intent. American and Iraqi military officials spent years planning the campaign to rid Iraq of ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"],", as if the absence of the jihadis would automatically lead Iraq toward the bright democratic future that George W. Bush’s Administration had envisaged when U.S. forces invaded the country, in 2003. But ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," has always derived much of its dangerous appeal from the corruption and cruelty of the Iraqi state."],["inline-embed",{"type":"callout","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22callout%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22inline-ad%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cp%3Eadvertisement%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%22%2C%22attrs%22%3A%7B%7D%7D","ref":""},["p","advertisement"]],["p","For three years, the Islamic State controlled half of Syria and a third of Iraq, a swath of territory approximately the size of Great Britain, which included millions of people. Several members of its senior leadership had been high-level military and intelligence officers in Saddam Hussein’s Baathist regime; they combined the structural prowess of a police state with the cosmic certainty of radical jihadism. The group blew up mosques and ",["a",{"href":"https://www.newyorker.com/news/daily-comment/isis-and-the-destruction-of-history"},"ancient archeological sites"],", and pursued a campaign of ethnic cleansing through mass murder and sexual slavery. It conscripted local bureaucrats, doctors, and teachers, often on pain of death, and devoted enormous effort to radicalizing a generation of children and inuring them to violence, suffering, and loss. At the height of its success, in 2014, there was a real possibility that ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," would capture Baghdad, and the Iraqi state would collapse. Now, more than a year after ",["a",{"href":"https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2017/02/06/the-desperate-battle-to-destroy-isis"},["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," lost Mosul"],"—its largest source of legitimacy, wealth, and power—hundreds of thousands of civilians are suffering at the hands of their liberators. Anyone with a perceived connection to ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"],", however tenuous or unclear, is being killed or cast out of society."],["inline-embed",{"type":"callout","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22callout%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22feature-medium%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22image%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522image%2522%252C%2522url%2522%253A%2522%252Fphotos%252F5c104b61c5aa777fdb411e61%2522%252C%2522width%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522height%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522caption%2522%253A%2522%2522%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%225c104b61c5aa777fdb411e61%5C%22%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%22%2C%22attrs%22%3A%7B%7D%7D","ref":""},["inline-embed",{"type":"image","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22image%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22%2Fphotos%2F5c104b61c5aa777fdb411e61%22%2C%22width%22%3A%22%22%2C%22height%22%3A%22%22%2C%22caption%22%3A%22%22%7D","ref":"5c104b61c5aa777fdb411e61"}]],["p","Not long ago, I met with a senior Iraqi intelligence official who is deeply involved in counterterrorism operations. For three hours, over tea and cigarettes, he described systematic criminality within the security forces, detailing patterns of battlefield executions, murders in detention centers, and coverups organized by the state. He spoke as a witness, but also as a participant; although he is in a position to have stopped certain abuses, by intervening he would have risked incurring accusations that he is sympathetic to the group he has sought to destroy."],["p","He believes that the Iraqi government’s response is as much a tactical blunder as it is a moral one; it plays directly into the jihadis’ narrative—that Sunnis, who make up a minority of the Iraqi population, cannot live safely under a government dominated by Shiites. “The reaction is one of vengeance—it is not well thought out,” he told me. “We rarely abide by the law.”"],["p","Thousands of men and boys have been convicted of ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," affiliation, and hundreds have been hanged. But, according to the senior intelligence official, these cases represent only a small fraction of the total number of detainees. “A few of the suspects are sent to court, but only to maintain the illusion that we have a justice system,” he said."],["p","Suspects are tried under a law that makes no distinction between a person who “assists terrorists” and one who commits violent crimes on behalf of an extremist group. The conviction rate is around ninety-eight per cent. Family members of the accused rarely show up to watch the hearings, out of fear that they will be detained, too. It’s not uncommon for relatives to be rounded up by the security forces and sent to remote desert camps, where they are denied food, medical services, and access to documents. “We’re deleting thousands of families from Iraqi society,” the official told me. “This is not just revenge on ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"],". This is revenge on Sunnis.”"],["inline-embed",{"type":"callout","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22callout%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22inline-ad%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cp%3Eadvertisement%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%22%2C%22attrs%22%3A%7B%7D%7D","ref":""},["p","advertisement"]],["p","Nine years ago, two C.I.A. officers walked into an Iraqi prison and saw a hallway filled with hooded men, about to be executed for supposed affiliation with Al Qaeda in Iraq, the group that gave birth to ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"],". “We were hammering A.Q.I., but the Iraqi government was just rounding up Sunnis,” one of the C.I.A. officers recalled. “And, for a moment, it worked.” But, instead of releasing the innocents, the Iraqi government sentenced them to death. “So, of course, they came back,” the officer said, of Al Qaeda in Iraq. “What do you expect? You literally killed their dads.”"],["p","Iraq is now entering one of the most delicate moments in its recent history. To the extent that ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," functioned as a state, it was entirely predatory. But, by having lost on the battlefield rather than being toppled by its own depravity, the caliphate lives on as a fantasy of Islamic justice and governance which is measured against the corrupt reality of the Iraqi state. What is at stake, in this post-conflict period, is whether the Iraqi government can win over the segment of the population for whom ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," seemed a viable alternative."]],["inline-embed",{"type":"section","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22section%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cp%3EOn%20an%20August%20night%20in%202011%2C%20eight%20jihadi%20commanders%20were%20sent%20across%20the%20border%20from%20Iraq%20into%20Syria%20by%20their%20leader%2C%20Abu%20Bakr%20al-Baghdadi%2C%20to%20infiltrate%20Syria%E2%80%99s%20nascent%20revolution.%20By%20late%202012%2C%20they%20had%20amassed%20hundreds%20of%20followers%20from%20dozens%20of%20countries%2C%20and%20were%20running%20training%20camps%20near%20Aleppo.%20During%20the%20next%20year%2C%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20helped%20the%20rebels%20in%20key%20battles%20against%20the%20Syrian%20regime%2C%20but%20as%20the%20group%20became%20stronger%20its%20strategic%20focus%20shifted%20to%20the%20formation%20of%20a%20caliphate.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22callout%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522callout%2522%252C%2522name%2522%253A%2522inset-left%2522%252C%2522body%2522%253A%2522%253Cinline-embed%2520type%253D%255C%2522cartoon%255C%2522%2520meta%253D%255C%2522%25257B%252522type%252522%25253A%252522cartoon%252522%25252C%252522url%252522%25253A%252522%25252Fcartoon%25252F5c12cc9aede0f93942f07857%252522%25252C%252522width%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25252C%252522height%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25252C%252522caption%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25257D%255C%2522%2520ref%253D%255C%25225c12cc9aede0f93942f07857%255C%2522%253E%253C%252Finline-embed%253E%2522%252C%2522attrs%2522%253A%257B%257D%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%22%5C%22%3E%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22cartoon%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522cartoon%2522%252C%2522url%2522%253A%2522%252Fcartoon%252F5c12cc9aede0f93942f07857%2522%252C%2522width%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522height%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522caption%2522%253A%2522%2522%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%225c12cc9aede0f93942f07857%5C%22%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%3Cp%3EIn%20June%2C%202014%2C%20a%20few%20hundred%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20fighters%20stormed%20back%20east%20across%20the%20desert%2C%20in%20mud-caked%20pickup%20trucks%2C%20and%20captured%20the%20Iraqi%20city%20of%20Mosul%2C%20essentially%20by%20mistake.%20In%20the%20preceding%20months%2C%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20had%20taken%20over%20Ramadi%2C%20Falluja%2C%20and%20Samarra.%20But%20Mosul%2C%20with%20almost%20two%20million%20residents%2C%20was%20the%20economic%20center%20of%20northern%20Iraq.%20The%20group%E2%80%99s%20plan%20was%20to%20take%20a%20few%20neighborhoods%20on%20Mosul%E2%80%99s%20western%20banks%20and%20break%20into%20a%20prison%2C%20to%20swell%20its%20ranks.%20Within%20a%20week%2C%20some%20sixty%20thousand%20Iraqi%20soldiers%20and%20federal%20police%20officers%2C%20many%20of%20whom%20were%20reluctant%20to%20die%20in%20defense%20of%20a%20Sunni%20city%2C%20had%20shed%20their%20uniforms%20and%20run%20away.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EFor%20Mosul%E2%80%99s%20residents%2C%20the%20announcement%20of%20a%20caliphate%20from%20within%20their%20city%20meant%20that%20the%20rest%20of%20their%20lives%20would%20be%20defined%20by%20their%20proximity%20to%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E.%20Some%20religious%20minorities%2C%20like%20Christians%2C%20could%20remain%20in%20the%20city%2C%20if%20they%20paid%20a%20religious%20tax%2C%20but%20Yazidis%20and%20Shiites%20faced%20enslavement%20or%20slaughter.%20Half%20a%20million%20civilians%20fled%20Mosul.%20The%20Islamic%20State%20found%20some%20support%2C%20owing%20to%20the%20abuses%20that%20Sunnis%20had%20suffered%20at%20the%20hands%20of%20the%20Iraqi%20government.%20But%20most%20citizens%20were%20stuck%20feigning%20allegiance%20to%20survive%2C%20despite%20the%20certainty%20that%20any%20compromise%20with%20the%20group%20would%20eventually%20taint%20them%20if%20Mosul%20were%20freed.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3ESome%20residents%20spent%20the%20next%20three%20years%20waiting%20out%20the%20situation%E2%80%94reading%2C%20smoking%2C%20counting%20the%20days%20until%20liberation.%20For%20others%2C%20interaction%20with%20the%20jihadis%20was%20not%20optional.%20The%20Islamic%20State%20did%20not%20dismantle%20the%20Iraqi%20bureaucracy%3B%20it%20appropriated%20it%2C%20and%20expanded%20it.%20There%20were%20departments%20in%20charge%20of%20alms-giving%2C%20the%20distribution%20of%20war%20spoils%2C%20hospitals%2C%20and%20the%20maintenance%20and%20health%20of%20rivers.%20Some%20institutions%20operated%20with%20greater%20efficiency%20and%20less%20corruption%20than%20before.%20But%2C%20for%20many%20bureaucrats%2C%20continuing%20in%20their%20duties%20meant%20participating%20in%20a%20sectarian%20criminal%20enterprise.%20The%20role%20of%20the%20estate%20authorities%2C%20for%20example%2C%20shifted%20from%20settling%20everyday%20land%20disputes%20to%20expropriating%20and%20redistributing%20Shiite%20property%20and%20homes.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EFor%20months%2C%20the%20Mosul%20civil%20defense%E2%80%94the%20city%E2%80%99s%20professional%20firefighters%20and%20rescue%20workers%E2%80%94continued%20to%20respond%20to%20gas%20and%20electrical%20fires.%20But%20soon%20Iraqi%20and%20U.S.%20forces%20began%20conducting%20sporadic%20bombing%20raids%2C%20and%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20informed%20the%20rescuers%20that%20if%20they%20didn%E2%80%99t%20help%20retrieve%20wounded%20jihadis%20from%20the%20rubble%20they%20would%20be%20killed.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EThe%20Iraqi%20government%20stopped%20paying%20salaries%E2%80%94%E2%80%9CIf%20they%20paid%20us%2C%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20might%20take%20the%20money%2C%E2%80%9D%20a%20young%20civil-defense%20worker%20whom%20I%E2%80%99ll%20call%20Mohammad%20told%20me%E2%80%94and%20so%20the%20rescuers%20risked%20their%20lives%20to%20save%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20fighters%20for%20free.%20%E2%80%9CFortunately%2C%20coalition%20planes%20never%20hit%20a%20civil-defense%20vehicle%2C%E2%80%9D%20Mohammad%20said.%20But%2C%20he%20recalled%2C%20%E2%80%9Cthis%20started%20to%20make%20problems%20for%20us%2C%20because%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20thought%20we%20were%20co%C3%B6perating%20with%20the%20coalition.%E2%80%9D%20Mohammad%20fell%20under%20particular%20scrutiny%3B%20he%20speaks%20near-fluent%20English%2C%20which%20he%20learned%20by%20watching%20American%20films.%20In%202015%2C%20he%20quit%20the%20civil%20defense%20and%20went%20into%20hiding.%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20fighters%20set%20fire%20to%20his%20house%20and%20his%20car.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22callout%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522callout%2522%252C%2522name%2522%253A%2522inline-ad%2522%252C%2522body%2522%253A%2522%253Cp%253Eadvertisement%253C%252Fp%253E%255Cn%2522%252C%2522attrs%2522%253A%257B%257D%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%22%5C%22%3E%3Cp%3Eadvertisement%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%22%7D","ref":""},["p","On an August night in 2011, eight jihadi commanders were sent across the border from Iraq into Syria by their leader, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, to infiltrate Syria’s nascent revolution. By late 2012, they had amassed hundreds of followers from dozens of countries, and were running training camps near Aleppo. During the next year, ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," helped the rebels in key battles against the Syrian regime, but as the group became stronger its strategic focus shifted to the formation of a caliphate."],["inline-embed",{"type":"callout","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22callout%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22inset-left%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22cartoon%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522cartoon%2522%252C%2522url%2522%253A%2522%252Fcartoon%252F5c12cc9aede0f93942f07857%2522%252C%2522width%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522height%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522caption%2522%253A%2522%2522%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%225c12cc9aede0f93942f07857%5C%22%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%22%2C%22attrs%22%3A%7B%7D%7D","ref":""},["inline-embed",{"type":"cartoon","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22cartoon%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22%2Fcartoon%2F5c12cc9aede0f93942f07857%22%2C%22width%22%3A%22%22%2C%22height%22%3A%22%22%2C%22caption%22%3A%22%22%7D","ref":"5c12cc9aede0f93942f07857"}]],["p","In June, 2014, a few hundred ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," fighters stormed back east across the desert, in mud-caked pickup trucks, and captured the Iraqi city of Mosul, essentially by mistake. In the preceding months, ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," had taken over Ramadi, Falluja, and Samarra. But Mosul, with almost two million residents, was the economic center of northern Iraq. The group’s plan was to take a few neighborhoods on Mosul’s western banks and break into a prison, to swell its ranks. Within a week, some sixty thousand Iraqi soldiers and federal police officers, many of whom were reluctant to die in defense of a Sunni city, had shed their uniforms and run away."],["p","For Mosul’s residents, the announcement of a caliphate from within their city meant that the rest of their lives would be defined by their proximity to ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"],". Some religious minorities, like Christians, could remain in the city, if they paid a religious tax, but Yazidis and Shiites faced enslavement or slaughter. Half a million civilians fled Mosul. The Islamic State found some support, owing to the abuses that Sunnis had suffered at the hands of the Iraqi government. But most citizens were stuck feigning allegiance to survive, despite the certainty that any compromise with the group would eventually taint them if Mosul were freed."],["p","Some residents spent the next three years waiting out the situation—reading, smoking, counting the days until liberation. For others, interaction with the jihadis was not optional. The Islamic State did not dismantle the Iraqi bureaucracy; it appropriated it, and expanded it. There were departments in charge of alms-giving, the distribution of war spoils, hospitals, and the maintenance and health of rivers. Some institutions operated with greater efficiency and less corruption than before. But, for many bureaucrats, continuing in their duties meant participating in a sectarian criminal enterprise. The role of the estate authorities, for example, shifted from settling everyday land disputes to expropriating and redistributing Shiite property and homes."],["p","For months, the Mosul civil defense—the city’s professional firefighters and rescue workers—continued to respond to gas and electrical fires. But soon Iraqi and U.S. forces began conducting sporadic bombing raids, and ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," informed the rescuers that if they didn’t help retrieve wounded jihadis from the rubble they would be killed."],["p","The Iraqi government stopped paying salaries—“If they paid us, ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," might take the money,” a young civil-defense worker whom I’ll call Mohammad told me—and so the rescuers risked their lives to save ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," fighters for free. “Fortunately, coalition planes never hit a civil-defense vehicle,” Mohammad said. But, he recalled, “this started to make problems for us, because ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," thought we were coöperating with the coalition.” Mohammad fell under particular scrutiny; he speaks near-fluent English, which he learned by watching American films. In 2015, he quit the civil defense and went into hiding. ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," fighters set fire to his house and his car."],["inline-embed",{"type":"callout","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22callout%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22inline-ad%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cp%3Eadvertisement%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%22%2C%22attrs%22%3A%7B%7D%7D","ref":""},["p","advertisement"]]],["inline-embed",{"type":"section","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22section%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cp%3EThe%20ground%20campaign%20to%20take%20back%20Mosul%20began%20in%20earnest%20in%20the%20fall%20of%202016.%20Until%20then%2C%20Iraq%E2%80%99s%20factions%20and%20militias%20had%20little%20incentive%20to%20co%C3%B6perate.%20For%20the%20Kurds%2C%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%E2%80%99s%20invasion%20of%20Mosul%20had%20created%20a%20%3Ca%20href%3D%5C%22https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newyorker.com%2Fnews%2Fnews-desk%2Fthe-limits-of-the-kurds-war-on-isis%5C%22%3Epower%20vacuum%3C%2Fa%3E%2C%20which%20they%20used%20to%20seize%20oil-rich%20territory%20and%20to%20try%20to%20renegotiate%20the%20boundaries%20of%20Kurdistan%20within%20Iraq.%20Shiite%20paramilitary%20groups%2C%20some%20of%20which%20had%20carried%20out%20thousands%20of%20attacks%20against%20American%20troops%20in%20the%20previous%20decade%2C%20had%20mobilized%20to%20prevent%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20from%20capturing%20Baghdad%2C%20but%20it%20was%20another%20two%20years%20before%20the%20Iraqi%20government%20integrated%20them%20into%20the%20armed%20forces.%20It%20was%20a%20Faustian%20bargain%3B%20the%20most%20powerful%20militias%2C%20which%20are%20collectively%20known%20as%20the%20%3Ca%20href%3D%5C%22https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newyorker.com%2Fnews%2Fnews-desk%2Fthe-dangers-of-the-iraqi-coalition-headed-toward-mosul%5C%22%3EHashd%20al-Sha%E2%80%99abi%3C%2Fa%3E%2C%20are%20trained%2C%20equipped%2C%20and%20funded%20by%20Iran%E2%80%99s%20Revolutionary%20Guard%2C%20and%20have%20a%20reputation%20for%20carrying%20out%20the%20kinds%20of%20sectarian%20abuses%20that%20had%20led%20many%20Sunnis%20to%20welcome%20the%20jihadis%20in%20Mosul.%20%E2%80%9CWithout%20the%20Hashd%20al-Sha%E2%80%99abi%2C%20there%20would%20be%20no%20security%20in%20this%20country%2C%E2%80%9D%20the%20senior%20Iraqi%20intelligence%20official%20told%20me.%20%E2%80%9CAnd%20yet%2C%20with%20them%2C%20there%20is%20no%20rule%20of%20law.%20They%20are%20above%20the%20Army%2C%20the%20law%2C%20and%20the%20sovereignty%20of%20Iraq.%E2%80%9D%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EThe%20Kurds%20attacked%20Mosul%20from%20the%20north%20and%20the%20east.%20Iraqi%20security%20forces%20approached%20from%20the%20south.%20American%20special-operations%20forces%20went%20in%2C%20too%E2%80%94officially%20in%20a%20supporting%20role%2C%20but%20they%20nevertheless%20frequently%20ended%20up%20in%20combat.%20The%20U.S.-led%20coalition%20decided%20to%20leave%20open%20the%20west%20as%20a%20kind%20of%20escape%20valve%3B%20this%20would%20allow%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20members%20to%20be%20picked%20off%20as%20they%20fled%20into%20the%20desert%2C%20toward%20Syria.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22callout%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522callout%2522%252C%2522name%2522%253A%2522feature-large%2522%252C%2522body%2522%253A%2522%253Cinline-embed%2520type%253D%255C%2522image%255C%2522%2520meta%253D%255C%2522%25257B%252522type%252522%25253A%252522image%252522%25252C%252522url%252522%25253A%252522%25252Fphotos%25252F5c104b753f04a501a075d8d4%252522%25252C%252522width%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25252C%252522height%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25252C%252522caption%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25257D%255C%2522%2520ref%253D%255C%25225c104b753f04a501a075d8d4%255C%2522%253E%253C%252Finline-embed%253E%2522%252C%2522attrs%2522%253A%257B%257D%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%22%5C%22%3E%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22image%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522image%2522%252C%2522url%2522%253A%2522%252Fphotos%252F5c104b753f04a501a075d8d4%2522%252C%2522width%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522height%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522caption%2522%253A%2522%2522%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%225c104b753f04a501a075d8d4%5C%22%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22callout%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522callout%2522%252C%2522name%2522%253A%2522inline-ad%2522%252C%2522body%2522%253A%2522%253Cp%253Eadvertisement%253C%252Fp%253E%255Cn%2522%252C%2522attrs%2522%253A%257B%257D%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%22%5C%22%3E%3Cp%3Eadvertisement%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%3Cp%3EWhat%20followed%20was%20the%20most%20intense%20urban%20combat%20since%20the%20Second%20World%20War.%20Air%20strikes%20pummelled%20villages%20and%20towns%20in%20Mosul%E2%80%99s%20periphery%2C%20so%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20contracted%20its%20territory%2C%20retreating%20to%20the%20city%2C%20along%20with%20thousands%20of%20civilians.%20%E2%80%9CThey%20told%20us%20that%20the%20Iraqi%20security%20forces%20would%20kill%20the%20men%20and%20rape%20the%20women%2C%E2%80%9D%20a%20young%20woman%20from%20the%20village%20of%20Shirqat%20told%20me.%20%E2%80%9CWe%20trusted%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20more%20than%20the%20Iraqi%20state.%E2%80%9D%20Other%20villagers%2C%20who%20had%20spent%20years%20awaiting%20liberation%2C%20were%20loaded%20onto%20buses%20at%20gunpoint%20by%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20fighters%2C%20and%20packed%20into%20Mosul%E2%80%99s%20front-line%20neighborhoods%2C%20to%20be%20used%20as%20human%20shields.%20In%20the%20ensuing%20months%2C%20the%20jihadis%20murdered%20hundreds%20of%20people%20who%20tried%20to%20escape%2C%20and%20hung%20bodies%20from%20electrical%20pylons.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%22%7D","ref":""},["p","The ground campaign to take back Mosul began in earnest in the fall of 2016. Until then, Iraq’s factions and militias had little incentive to coöperate. For the Kurds, ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"],"’s invasion of Mosul had created a ",["a",{"href":"https://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/the-limits-of-the-kurds-war-on-isis"},"power vacuum"],", which they used to seize oil-rich territory and to try to renegotiate the boundaries of Kurdistan within Iraq. Shiite paramilitary groups, some of which had carried out thousands of attacks against American troops in the previous decade, had mobilized to prevent ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," from capturing Baghdad, but it was another two years before the Iraqi government integrated them into the armed forces. It was a Faustian bargain; the most powerful militias, which are collectively known as the ",["a",{"href":"https://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/the-dangers-of-the-iraqi-coalition-headed-toward-mosul"},"Hashd al-Sha’abi"],", are trained, equipped, and funded by Iran’s Revolutionary Guard, and have a reputation for carrying out the kinds of sectarian abuses that had led many Sunnis to welcome the jihadis in Mosul. “Without the Hashd al-Sha’abi, there would be no security in this country,” the senior Iraqi intelligence official told me. “And yet, with them, there is no rule of law. They are above the Army, the law, and the sovereignty of Iraq.”"],["p","The Kurds attacked Mosul from the north and the east. Iraqi security forces approached from the south. American special-operations forces went in, too—officially in a supporting role, but they nevertheless frequently ended up in combat. The U.S.-led coalition decided to leave open the west as a kind of escape valve; this would allow ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," members to be picked off as they fled into the desert, toward Syria."],["inline-embed",{"type":"callout","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22callout%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22feature-large%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22image%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522image%2522%252C%2522url%2522%253A%2522%252Fphotos%252F5c104b753f04a501a075d8d4%2522%252C%2522width%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522height%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522caption%2522%253A%2522%2522%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%225c104b753f04a501a075d8d4%5C%22%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%22%2C%22attrs%22%3A%7B%7D%7D","ref":""},["inline-embed",{"type":"image","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22image%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22%2Fphotos%2F5c104b753f04a501a075d8d4%22%2C%22width%22%3A%22%22%2C%22height%22%3A%22%22%2C%22caption%22%3A%22%22%7D","ref":"5c104b753f04a501a075d8d4"}]],["inline-embed",{"type":"callout","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22callout%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22inline-ad%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cp%3Eadvertisement%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%22%2C%22attrs%22%3A%7B%7D%7D","ref":""},["p","advertisement"]],["p","What followed was the most intense urban combat since the Second World War. Air strikes pummelled villages and towns in Mosul’s periphery, so ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," contracted its territory, retreating to the city, along with thousands of civilians. “They told us that the Iraqi security forces would kill the men and rape the women,” a young woman from the village of Shirqat told me. “We trusted ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," more than the Iraqi state.” Other villagers, who had spent years awaiting liberation, were loaded onto buses at gunpoint by ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," fighters, and packed into Mosul’s front-line neighborhoods, to be used as human shields. In the ensuing months, the jihadis murdered hundreds of people who tried to escape, and hung bodies from electrical pylons."]],["inline-embed",{"type":"section","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22section%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cp%3EBy%20early%202017%2C%20Mosul%20was%20half%20free.%20The%20city%20is%20bisected%20by%20the%20Tigris%20River.%20Its%20east%20side%20has%20wide%20avenues%20and%20low%20buildings.%20Backed%20by%20coalition%20airpower%2C%20East%20Mosul%20was%20taken%20mostly%20by%20%C3%A9lite%20Iraqi%20counterterrorism%20forces%2C%20fighting%20house%20to%20house.%20They%20took%20care%20to%20minimize%20civilian%20casualties%2C%20and%20suffered%20tremendous%20losses%20of%20their%20own.%20By%20the%20end%20of%20the%20battle%20for%20East%20Mosul%2C%20as%20much%20as%20seventy-five%20per%20cent%20of%20the%20counterterrorism%20forces%20had%20been%20injured%20or%20killed.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EThe%20combat%20was%20much%20worse%20in%20West%20Mosul%E2%80%94especially%20in%20the%20Old%20City%2C%20a%20densely%20populated%20warren%20of%20alleyways%2C%20tunnels%2C%20and%20souks%20nestled%20against%20the%20banks%20of%20the%20Tigris.%20Its%20streets%20were%20too%20narrow%20for%20armored%20vehicles%20to%20pass%20through%2C%20and%20jihadis%20could%20easily%20slip%20between%20roofs%20and%20alleys%20and%20basements.%20To%20an%20outside%20force%2C%20it%20was%20practically%20impenetrable.%20The%20coalition%20bombed%20all%20five%20of%20Mosul%E2%80%99s%20bridges%20and%20sealed%20off%20the%20western%20escape%20valve%2C%20while%20thousands%20of%20Iraqi%20soldiers%2C%20federal%20police%20officers%2C%20and%20Hashd%20fighters%20besieged%20the%20Old%20City.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EThe%20Old%20City%20was%20home%20to%20Mosul%E2%80%99s%20richest%20history%20and%20poorest%20residents.%20Thenoon%20Younnes%20Abdullah%2C%20a%20middle-aged%20father%20with%20a%20bushy%20mustache%2C%20dyed%20brown%2C%20had%20spent%20the%20past%20couple%20of%20decades%20working%20as%20a%20day%20laborer%2C%20until%20his%20body%20gave%20out%3B%20to%20provide%20for%20his%20wife%2C%20Alaa%2C%20and%20their%20four%20children%2C%20he%20resorted%20to%20selling%20bootleg%20gasoline.%20Like%20most%20of%20his%20neighbors%2C%20he%20resented%20the%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20fighters%2C%20who%20swaggered%20through%20the%20souks%2C%20flush%20with%20cash%2C%20telling%20him%20how%20to%20live%E2%80%94especially%20the%20foreigners%2C%20who%20barely%20spoke%20Arabic%20and%20had%20no%20connection%20to%20Mosul.%20Some%20of%20them%20had%20converted%20to%20Islam%20only%20a%20few%20months%20before%20coming%20to%20Iraq%20for%20the%20jihad.%20Abdullah%E2%80%99s%20family%20had%20lived%20in%20the%20same%20cluster%20of%20houses%2C%20on%20the%20same%20block%2C%20with%20the%20same%20neighboring%20families%2C%20for%20as%20many%20generations%20as%20he%20could%20remember.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EFor%20three%20years%2C%20the%20Iraqi%20Army%20had%20told%20civilians%20to%20stay%20at%20home%20and%20wait%20for%20liberation%2C%20and%20Abdullah%20and%20his%20family%20had%20listened.%20Now%2C%20as%20the%20Army%20encircled%20the%20Old%20City%2C%20electricity%20and%20water%20supplies%20were%20cut%20off%2C%20and%20life%20became%20impossible.%20People%20began%20to%20starve.%20The%20jihadis%20were%20breaking%20into%20homes%2C%20stealing%20food%2C%20and%20digging%20tunnels%20between%20basements%2C%20to%20pass%20undetected.%20They%20set%20up%20firing%20positions%20on%20people%E2%80%99s%20roofs%2C%20and%20stockpiled%20explosives%20in%20living%20rooms.%20Anyone%20who%20resisted%20was%20killed.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EThe%20coalition%20concluded%20that%20the%20Old%20City%20could%20not%20be%20captured%20according%20to%20the%20rules%20of%20engagement%20that%20had%20governed%20the%20battle%20in%20East%20Mosul%2C%20so%20it%20loosened%20its%20requirements%20for%20calling%20in%20an%20air%20strike.%20In%20March%2C%20the%20U.S.%20dropped%20a%20five-hundred-pound%20bomb%20on%20a%20roof%20in%20the%20Old%20City%2C%20in%20an%20effort%20to%20kill%20two%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20snipers.%20The%20explosion%20killed%20a%20hundred%20and%20five%20civilians%20who%20had%20been%20sheltering%20inside%20the%20building.%20Survivors%20reported%20that%20there%20were%20no%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20fighters%20in%20the%20vicinity%20at%20the%20time%20of%20the%20strike.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EOne%20night%2C%20when%20the%20shelling%20relented%2C%20Abdullah%20and%20his%20family%20hurried%20downhill%20to%20the%20banks%20of%20the%20Tigris%2C%20carrying%20inner%20tubes%20and%20two%20large%20coolers.%20None%20of%20them%20knew%20how%20to%20swim.%20Abdullah%20helped%20the%20kids%20into%20the%20coolers%E2%80%94two%20in%20each%E2%80%94and%20he%20and%20Alaa%20climbed%20onto%20the%20inner%20tubes%2C%20clinging%20to%20the%20children%20and%20each%20other%20as%20they%20floated%20downstream%2C%20to%20liberated%20territory.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EBy%20early%20July%2C%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20fighters%20had%20killed%20thousands%20of%20government%20troops%20and%20police%20officers%2C%20and%20Iraqi%20commanders%20were%20under%20enormous%20pressure%20to%20finish%20the%20battle.%20The%20next%20few%20weeks%20were%20a%20bloodbath.%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20fighters%20who%20surrendered%20were%20executed%20on%20the%20spot.%20Iraqi%20security%20forces%20filmed%20themselves%20hurling%20captives%20off%20a%20cliff%2C%20then%20shooting%20them%20as%20they%20lay%20dying%20on%20the%20rocks%20below.%20Helicopters%20buzzed%20the%20Tigris%2C%20bombing%20people%20as%20they%20tried%20to%20swim%20across.%20The%20troops%20assumed%20that%20anyone%20still%20living%20in%20the%20Old%20City%20sided%20with%20the%20Islamic%20State.%20For%20the%20rest%20of%20the%20month%2C%20corpses%20bobbed%20downstream%2C%20dressed%20in%20civilian%20clothes.%20%E2%80%9CWe%20killed%20them%20all%E2%80%94Daesh%2C%20men%2C%20women%2C%20and%20children%2C%E2%80%9D%20an%20Iraqi%20Army%20officer%20told%20a%20Middle%20Eastern%20news%20site%2C%20using%20the%20Arabic%20acronym%20for%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E.%20As%20he%20spoke%2C%20his%20colleagues%20dragged%20a%20suspect%20through%20the%20streets%20by%20a%20rope%20tied%20around%20his%20neck.%20%E2%80%9CWe%20are%20doing%20the%20same%20thing%20as%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E.%20People%20went%20down%20to%20the%20river%20to%20get%20water%2C%20because%20they%20were%20dying%20of%20thirst%2C%20and%20we%20killed%20them.%E2%80%9D%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22callout%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522callout%2522%252C%2522name%2522%253A%2522inline-ad%2522%252C%2522body%2522%253A%2522%253Cp%253Eadvertisement%253C%252Fp%253E%255Cn%2522%252C%2522attrs%2522%253A%257B%257D%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%22%5C%22%3E%3Cp%3Eadvertisement%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%3Cp%3EWhen%20the%20battle%20was%20over%2C%20soldiers%20used%20construction%20equipment%20to%20shovel%20rubble%20into%20the%20entrances%20of%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20tunnels%E2%80%94ostensibly%20to%20suffocate%20any%20remaining%20jihadis%2C%20but%20also%20to%20mingle%20corpses%20and%20concrete%2C%20thereby%20obscuring%20the%20scale%20of%20the%20atrocities.%20As%20late%20as%20March%20of%20this%20year%2C%20journalists%20were%20still%20finding%20the%20bodies%20of%20women%20and%20children%20on%20the%20riverbanks%2C%20blindfolded%2C%20with%20their%20hands%20tied%20behind%20their%20backs%20and%20bullet%20holes%20in%20their%20skulls.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%22%7D","ref":""},["p","By early 2017, Mosul was half free. The city is bisected by the Tigris River. Its east side has wide avenues and low buildings. Backed by coalition airpower, East Mosul was taken mostly by élite Iraqi counterterrorism forces, fighting house to house. They took care to minimize civilian casualties, and suffered tremendous losses of their own. By the end of the battle for East Mosul, as much as seventy-five per cent of the counterterrorism forces had been injured or killed."],["p","The combat was much worse in West Mosul—especially in the Old City, a densely populated warren of alleyways, tunnels, and souks nestled against the banks of the Tigris. Its streets were too narrow for armored vehicles to pass through, and jihadis could easily slip between roofs and alleys and basements. To an outside force, it was practically impenetrable. The coalition bombed all five of Mosul’s bridges and sealed off the western escape valve, while thousands of Iraqi soldiers, federal police officers, and Hashd fighters besieged the Old City."],["p","The Old City was home to Mosul’s richest history and poorest residents. Thenoon Younnes Abdullah, a middle-aged father with a bushy mustache, dyed brown, had spent the past couple of decades working as a day laborer, until his body gave out; to provide for his wife, Alaa, and their four children, he resorted to selling bootleg gasoline. Like most of his neighbors, he resented the ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," fighters, who swaggered through the souks, flush with cash, telling him how to live—especially the foreigners, who barely spoke Arabic and had no connection to Mosul. Some of them had converted to Islam only a few months before coming to Iraq for the jihad. Abdullah’s family had lived in the same cluster of houses, on the same block, with the same neighboring families, for as many generations as he could remember."],["p","For three years, the Iraqi Army had told civilians to stay at home and wait for liberation, and Abdullah and his family had listened. Now, as the Army encircled the Old City, electricity and water supplies were cut off, and life became impossible. People began to starve. The jihadis were breaking into homes, stealing food, and digging tunnels between basements, to pass undetected. They set up firing positions on people’s roofs, and stockpiled explosives in living rooms. Anyone who resisted was killed."],["p","The coalition concluded that the Old City could not be captured according to the rules of engagement that had governed the battle in East Mosul, so it loosened its requirements for calling in an air strike. In March, the U.S. dropped a five-hundred-pound bomb on a roof in the Old City, in an effort to kill two ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," snipers. The explosion killed a hundred and five civilians who had been sheltering inside the building. Survivors reported that there were no ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," fighters in the vicinity at the time of the strike."],["p","One night, when the shelling relented, Abdullah and his family hurried downhill to the banks of the Tigris, carrying inner tubes and two large coolers. None of them knew how to swim. Abdullah helped the kids into the coolers—two in each—and he and Alaa climbed onto the inner tubes, clinging to the children and each other as they floated downstream, to liberated territory."],["p","By early July, ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," fighters had killed thousands of government troops and police officers, and Iraqi commanders were under enormous pressure to finish the battle. The next few weeks were a bloodbath. ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," fighters who surrendered were executed on the spot. Iraqi security forces filmed themselves hurling captives off a cliff, then shooting them as they lay dying on the rocks below. Helicopters buzzed the Tigris, bombing people as they tried to swim across. The troops assumed that anyone still living in the Old City sided with the Islamic State. For the rest of the month, corpses bobbed downstream, dressed in civilian clothes. “We killed them all—Daesh, men, women, and children,” an Iraqi Army officer told a Middle Eastern news site, using the Arabic acronym for ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"],". As he spoke, his colleagues dragged a suspect through the streets by a rope tied around his neck. “We are doing the same thing as ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"],". People went down to the river to get water, because they were dying of thirst, and we killed them.”"],["inline-embed",{"type":"callout","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22callout%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22inline-ad%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cp%3Eadvertisement%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%22%2C%22attrs%22%3A%7B%7D%7D","ref":""},["p","advertisement"]],["p","When the battle was over, soldiers used construction equipment to shovel rubble into the entrances of ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," tunnels—ostensibly to suffocate any remaining jihadis, but also to mingle corpses and concrete, thereby obscuring the scale of the atrocities. As late as March of this year, journalists were still finding the bodies of women and children on the riverbanks, blindfolded, with their hands tied behind their backs and bullet holes in their skulls."]],["inline-embed",{"type":"section","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22section%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cp%3EA%20year%20and%20a%20half%20after%20Iraq%20declared%20victory%2C%20the%20Old%20City%20is%20in%20ruins.%20Sunlight%20gleams%20through%20bullet%20holes%20in%20tin%20garage%20doors.%20Massive%20blocks%20of%20concrete%20dangle%20from%20broken%20roofs.%20The%20floors%20of%20apartment%20buildings%20remain%20as%20they%20fell%2C%20in%20layers%2C%20having%20crushed%20whatever%20was%20between%20them.%20The%20U.N.%20estimates%20that%20the%20battle%20for%20Mosul%20has%20left%20behind%20around%20ten%20million%20tons%20of%20rubble.%20Some%20stone%20structures%20have%20landed%20at%20odd%20angles%2C%20to%20disorienting%20effect%2C%20as%20if%20gravity%20were%20pulling%20in%20every%20direction.%20There%20are%20burned-out%20power%20lines%2C%20and%20staircases%20to%20nowhere.%20It%20is%20completely%20silent.%20Near%20the%20site%20of%20an%20old%20post%20office%2C%20there%20is%20a%20single%20intact%20traffic%20light.%20It%20changes%20every%20thirty%20seconds%2C%20for%20no%20one.%20Every%20few%20feet%20you%20catch%20the%20smell%20of%20desiccated%20corpses.%20Also%20inescapable%20is%20the%20scale%20of%20history%2C%20obliterated.%20Many%20of%20the%20buildings%20were%20continuously%20inhabited%20from%20the%20seventh%20century%20until%20the%20second%20week%20of%20July%2C%202017.%20To%20walk%20through%20the%20Old%20City%20is%20to%20tread%20on%20its%20final%20generations%E2%80%99%20graves.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EShortly%20after%20the%20battle%20ended%2C%20Mohammad%20returned%20to%20his%20job%20in%20the%20civil%20defense.%20Every%20day%2C%20locals%20lined%20up%20outside%20a%20temporary%20fire%20station%20in%20West%20Mosul%20and%20asked%20for%20help%20retrieving%20the%20bodies%20of%20their%20relatives.%20%E2%80%9CWe%20recorded%20their%20names%20and%20gave%20them%20a%20date%2C%E2%80%9D%20he%20recalled.%20%E2%80%9CAnd%20when%20their%20date%20came%20they%20would%20come%20with%20us%20to%20the%20Old%20City%20and%20show%20us%20the%20house%20that%20had%20been%20hit%20by%20an%20air%20strike%2C%20and%20we%20would%20dig%20until%20we%20could%20take%20out%20the%20body.%E2%80%9D%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EThe%20coalition%20has%20acknowledged%20a%20civilian%20death%20toll%20in%20the%20low%20hundreds.%20But%20the%20West%20Mosul%20civil%20defense%20has%20retrieved%20thousands%20of%20corpses%20from%20the%20Old%20City.%20Last%20December%2C%20the%20Associated%20Press%20obtained%20a%20list%20of%20nearly%20ten%20thousand%20civilians%20whose%20bodies%20had%20been%20registered%20at%20the%20local%20morgue.%20Most%20had%20been%20crushed%20to%20death%20by%20falling%20concrete%3B%20for%20others%2C%20the%20cause%20of%20death%20had%20been%20entered%20into%20the%20morgue%E2%80%99s%20database%20simply%20as%20%E2%80%9Cblown%20to%20pieces.%E2%80%9D%20(Thomas%20Veale%2C%20a%20U.S.%20Army%20colonel%20and%20a%20spokesman%20for%20the%20coalition%2C%20told%20the%20A.P.%20that%20it%20was%20%E2%80%9Cirresponsible%E2%80%9D%20to%20draw%20attention%20to%20civilian%20casualties%20in%20West%20Mosul.%20If%20not%20for%20the%20coalition%E2%80%99s%20campaign%2C%20he%20said%2C%20Iraqis%20would%20have%20suffered%20years%20of%20%E2%80%9Cneedless%20death%20and%20mutilation%E2%80%9D%20at%20the%20hands%20of%20%E2%80%9Cterrorists%20who%20lack%20any%20ethical%20or%20moral%20standards.%E2%80%9D)%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3E%E2%80%9CAll%20of%20them%20are%20civilians%2C%E2%80%9D%20Mohammad%20said.%20%E2%80%9CWhen%20we%20find%20unknown%20bodies%2C%20we%20leave%20them%20behind%2C%E2%80%9D%20because%20there%20would%20be%20no%20way%20to%20apply%20for%20a%20death%20certificate%20or%20to%20return%20a%20corpse%20to%20its%20family%20for%20burial.%20%E2%80%9CSometimes%20people%20come%20here%20and%20tell%20us%20that%20they%20have%20dead%20relatives%20in%20the%20Old%20City%2C%20but%20we%20know%20that%20they%20are%20not%20%3Cem%3Efrom%3C%2Fem%3E%20the%20Old%20City%2C%E2%80%9D%20Mohammad%20said.%20%E2%80%9CThey%20are%20from%20Qayyarah%20or%20Shirqat%2C%E2%80%9D%20towns%20where%20the%20Islamic%20State%20had%20more%20support.%20When%20that%20happens%2C%20civil-defense%20workers%20infer%20an%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20link%20and%20refuse%20to%20retrieve%20the%20corpse.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EThe%20skeletons%20in%20the%20rubble%20have%20not%20been%20picked%20clean%20by%20animals%2C%20or%20bleached%20white%20by%20the%20sun.%20There%20are%20fingernails%20and%20yellow%20teeth%20and%20dusty%20clumps%20of%20hair.%20Bone%20fragments%20line%20the%20roads%2C%20amid%20scraps%20of%20fabric%20and%20leather%20and%20glass.%20Near%20the%20river%2C%20I%20saw%20a%20torso%20dangling%20loosely%20from%20a%20mess%20of%20twisted%20rebar%E2%80%94swaying%20hands%2C%20fractured%20skull.%20Blackened%20ligaments%20drooped%20from%20the%20arms.%20%E2%80%9CDaesh%2C%E2%80%9D%20a%20stranger%20said%20to%20me%2C%20smoking%20a%20cigarette%2C%20pointing%20at%20the%20corpse.%20He%20kept%20moving.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22callout%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522callout%2522%252C%2522name%2522%253A%2522inset-left%2522%252C%2522body%2522%253A%2522%253Cinline-embed%2520type%253D%255C%2522cartoon%255C%2522%2520meta%253D%255C%2522%25257B%252522type%252522%25253A%252522cartoon%252522%25252C%252522url%252522%25253A%252522%25252Fcartoon%25252F5c12cc9a9f6c733af90adcb5%252522%25252C%252522width%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25252C%252522height%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25252C%252522caption%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25257D%255C%2522%2520ref%253D%255C%25225c12cc9a9f6c733af90adcb5%255C%2522%253E%253C%252Finline-embed%253E%2522%252C%2522attrs%2522%253A%257B%257D%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%22%5C%22%3E%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22cartoon%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522cartoon%2522%252C%2522url%2522%253A%2522%252Fcartoon%252F5c12cc9a9f6c733af90adcb5%2522%252C%2522width%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522height%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522caption%2522%253A%2522%2522%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%225c12cc9a9f6c733af90adcb5%5C%22%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%3Cp%3ENearby%2C%20I%20met%20Thenoon%20Younnes%20Abdullah.%20He%20waved%2C%20and%20carefully%20wound%20his%20way%20down%20a%20three-story%20pile%20of%20rubble%E2%80%94the%20site%20of%20his%20former%20home%E2%80%94with%20his%20ten-year-old%20son.%20The%20family%20had%20returned%20to%20salvage%20whatever%20they%20could.%20Everything%20of%20any%20value%20had%20already%20been%20looted%2C%20but%20they%20rescued%20a%20broken%20generator%2C%20and%20tied%20it%20to%20the%20back%20of%20their%20car.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EAbdullah%20told%20me%20that%2C%20after%20the%20battle%2C%20his%20cousins%20were%20the%20first%20in%20his%20family%20to%20return%20to%20the%20Old%20City%3B%20as%20soon%20as%20they%20opened%20their%20door%2C%20they%20were%20blown%20apart%20by%20I.E.D.s.%20Months%20later%2C%20when%20Abdullah%20arrived%2C%20he%20found%20his%20own%20house%20in%20ruins%2C%20and%20several%20dead%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20fighters%20inside.%20He%20also%20found%20Alaa%E2%80%99s%20mother%E2%80%99s%20corpse%3B%20she%20had%20stayed%20behind%2C%20too%20frail%20to%20run%20away.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EAbdullah%20led%20me%20up%20the%20hill%20of%20tangled%20metal%20and%20concrete%2C%20and%20we%20entered%20his%20house%20by%20ducking%20under%20a%20staircase%2C%20through%20a%20hole%20in%20the%20bathroom%20wall.%20On%20the%20floor%20of%20the%20dining%20room%20were%20three%20stains%2C%20where%20fluids%20had%20leaked%20out%20as%20the%20bodies%20decomposed.%20Abdullah%E2%80%99s%20brother%20died%20across%20the%20street%2C%20but%20his%20body%20hasn%E2%80%99t%20been%20found.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22callout%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522callout%2522%252C%2522name%2522%253A%2522inline-ad%2522%252C%2522body%2522%253A%2522%253Cp%253Eadvertisement%253C%252Fp%253E%255Cn%2522%252C%2522attrs%2522%253A%257B%257D%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%22%5C%22%3E%3Cp%3Eadvertisement%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%3Cp%3EIt%20was%20difficult%20to%20move.%20The%20floor%20was%20littered%20with%20debris%2C%20but%20I%20noticed%20transistors%2C%20ball%20bearings%2C%20and%20other%20bomb-making%20materials%20scattered%20about.%20Then%2C%20on%20my%20way%20out%2C%20my%20foot%20knocked%20over%20a%20concrete%20block%20and%20uncovered%20an%20I.E.D.%20I%20stopped%2C%20and%20noticed%20two%20other%20unexploded%20bombs%20a%20few%20feet%20away%2C%20as%20well%20as%20four%20detonators.%20We%20climbed%20back%20out%20through%20the%20hole%20in%20the%20bathroom%20wall%2C%20and%20came%20down%20the%20hill%2C%20past%20an%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20corpse%20in%20rotting%20leather%20sandals.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EReconstruction%20in%20the%20Old%20City%20will%20cost%20billions%20of%20dollars%2C%20according%20to%20the%20U.N.%2C%20but%2C%20aside%20from%20the%20exorbitant%20cost%2C%20I%20had%20the%20impression%20that%20the%20Iraqi%20government%20has%20been%20content%20to%20leave%20it%20in%20ruins%2C%20as%20a%20kind%20of%20punishment.%20Abdullah%20told%20me%20that%20he%20had%20seen%20no%20evidence%20of%20institutional%20cleanup%E2%80%94only%20posters%20from%20N.G.O.s%2C%20warning%20about%20the%20perils%20of%20walking%20in%20areas%20filled%20with%20unexploded%20ordnance%2C%20which%20still%20regularly%20kills%20people%20in%20the%20Old%20City.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EAbdullah%20and%20his%20family%20piled%20into%20their%20car%20and%20headed%20to%20another%20part%20of%20the%20city%2C%20where%20they%20were%20staying%20in%20an%20abandoned%2C%20mostly%20destroyed%20building.%20He%20navigated%20by%20peering%20through%20a%20hole%20in%20the%20windshield%2C%20caused%20by%20shelling%20more%20than%20a%20year%20earlier.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%22%7D","ref":""},["p","A year and a half after Iraq declared victory, the Old City is in ruins. Sunlight gleams through bullet holes in tin garage doors. Massive blocks of concrete dangle from broken roofs. The floors of apartment buildings remain as they fell, in layers, having crushed whatever was between them. The U.N. estimates that the battle for Mosul has left behind around ten million tons of rubble. Some stone structures have landed at odd angles, to disorienting effect, as if gravity were pulling in every direction. There are burned-out power lines, and staircases to nowhere. It is completely silent. Near the site of an old post office, there is a single intact traffic light. It changes every thirty seconds, for no one. Every few feet you catch the smell of desiccated corpses. Also inescapable is the scale of history, obliterated. Many of the buildings were continuously inhabited from the seventh century until the second week of July, 2017. To walk through the Old City is to tread on its final generations’ graves."],["p","Shortly after the battle ended, Mohammad returned to his job in the civil defense. Every day, locals lined up outside a temporary fire station in West Mosul and asked for help retrieving the bodies of their relatives. “We recorded their names and gave them a date,” he recalled. “And when their date came they would come with us to the Old City and show us the house that had been hit by an air strike, and we would dig until we could take out the body.”"],["p","The coalition has acknowledged a civilian death toll in the low hundreds. But the West Mosul civil defense has retrieved thousands of corpses from the Old City. Last December, the Associated Press obtained a list of nearly ten thousand civilians whose bodies had been registered at the local morgue. Most had been crushed to death by falling concrete; for others, the cause of death had been entered into the morgue’s database simply as “blown to pieces.” (Thomas Veale, a U.S. Army colonel and a spokesman for the coalition, told the A.P. that it was “irresponsible” to draw attention to civilian casualties in West Mosul. If not for the coalition’s campaign, he said, Iraqis would have suffered years of “needless death and mutilation” at the hands of “terrorists who lack any ethical or moral standards.”)"],["p","“All of them are civilians,” Mohammad said. “When we find unknown bodies, we leave them behind,” because there would be no way to apply for a death certificate or to return a corpse to its family for burial. “Sometimes people come here and tell us that they have dead relatives in the Old City, but we know that they are not ",["em","from"]," the Old City,” Mohammad said. “They are from Qayyarah or Shirqat,” towns where the Islamic State had more support. When that happens, civil-defense workers infer an ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," link and refuse to retrieve the corpse."],["p","The skeletons in the rubble have not been picked clean by animals, or bleached white by the sun. There are fingernails and yellow teeth and dusty clumps of hair. Bone fragments line the roads, amid scraps of fabric and leather and glass. Near the river, I saw a torso dangling loosely from a mess of twisted rebar—swaying hands, fractured skull. Blackened ligaments drooped from the arms. “Daesh,” a stranger said to me, smoking a cigarette, pointing at the corpse. He kept moving."],["inline-embed",{"type":"callout","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22callout%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22inset-left%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22cartoon%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522cartoon%2522%252C%2522url%2522%253A%2522%252Fcartoon%252F5c12cc9a9f6c733af90adcb5%2522%252C%2522width%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522height%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522caption%2522%253A%2522%2522%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%225c12cc9a9f6c733af90adcb5%5C%22%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%22%2C%22attrs%22%3A%7B%7D%7D","ref":""},["inline-embed",{"type":"cartoon","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22cartoon%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22%2Fcartoon%2F5c12cc9a9f6c733af90adcb5%22%2C%22width%22%3A%22%22%2C%22height%22%3A%22%22%2C%22caption%22%3A%22%22%7D","ref":"5c12cc9a9f6c733af90adcb5"}]],["p","Nearby, I met Thenoon Younnes Abdullah. He waved, and carefully wound his way down a three-story pile of rubble—the site of his former home—with his ten-year-old son. The family had returned to salvage whatever they could. Everything of any value had already been looted, but they rescued a broken generator, and tied it to the back of their car."],["p","Abdullah told me that, after the battle, his cousins were the first in his family to return to the Old City; as soon as they opened their door, they were blown apart by I.E.D.s. Months later, when Abdullah arrived, he found his own house in ruins, and several dead ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," fighters inside. He also found Alaa’s mother’s corpse; she had stayed behind, too frail to run away."],["p","Abdullah led me up the hill of tangled metal and concrete, and we entered his house by ducking under a staircase, through a hole in the bathroom wall. On the floor of the dining room were three stains, where fluids had leaked out as the bodies decomposed. Abdullah’s brother died across the street, but his body hasn’t been found."],["inline-embed",{"type":"callout","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22callout%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22inline-ad%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cp%3Eadvertisement%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%22%2C%22attrs%22%3A%7B%7D%7D","ref":""},["p","advertisement"]],["p","It was difficult to move. The floor was littered with debris, but I noticed transistors, ball bearings, and other bomb-making materials scattered about. Then, on my way out, my foot knocked over a concrete block and uncovered an I.E.D. I stopped, and noticed two other unexploded bombs a few feet away, as well as four detonators. We climbed back out through the hole in the bathroom wall, and came down the hill, past an ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," corpse in rotting leather sandals."],["p","Reconstruction in the Old City will cost billions of dollars, according to the U.N., but, aside from the exorbitant cost, I had the impression that the Iraqi government has been content to leave it in ruins, as a kind of punishment. Abdullah told me that he had seen no evidence of institutional cleanup—only posters from N.G.O.s, warning about the perils of walking in areas filled with unexploded ordnance, which still regularly kills people in the Old City."],["p","Abdullah and his family piled into their car and headed to another part of the city, where they were staying in an abandoned, mostly destroyed building. He navigated by peering through a hole in the windshield, caused by shelling more than a year earlier."]],["inline-embed",{"type":"section","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22section%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cp%3EThe%20war%20against%20the%20Islamic%20State%20displaced%20a%20million%20people%20in%20Nineveh%20Province.%20Civilians%20who%20had%20fled%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20at%20the%20outset%2C%20in%202014%2C%20were%20asked%20by%20Kurdish%20and%20Iraqi%20intelligence%20officers%20to%20inform%20on%20neighbors%20who%20had%20assisted%20the%20group.%20The%20names%20were%20then%20entered%20into%20databases%20of%20terrorism%20suspects%2C%20available%20to%20Iraqi%20security%20branches%2C%20including%20the%20Hashd%20militias.%20As%20the%20war%20dragged%20on%2C%20the%20lists%20became%20increasingly%20unreliable.%20People%20reported%20their%20enemies%2C%20and%20wielded%20the%20threat%20of%20denunciation%20in%20personal%2C%20tribal%2C%20and%20workplace%20disputes.%20%E2%80%9CWe%20have%20thousands%20of%20suspects%20in%20custody%20whose%20names%20were%20falsely%20reported%2C%20or%20are%20based%20on%20incorrect%20information%2C%20and%20they%20are%20treated%20as%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20members%2C%E2%80%9D%20the%20senior%20Iraqi%20intelligence%20official%20told%20me.%20He%20said%20that%20some%20Hashd%20fighters%20ran%20an%20extortion%20racket%2C%20demanding%20thousands%20of%20dollars%20from%20civilians%20and%20adding%20their%20names%20to%20the%20terrorism%20database%20if%20they%20couldn%E2%80%99t%20pay.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22callout%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522callout%2522%252C%2522name%2522%253A%2522feature-medium%2522%252C%2522body%2522%253A%2522%253Cinline-embed%2520type%253D%255C%2522callout%255C%2522%2520meta%253D%255C%2522%25257B%252522type%252522%25253A%252522callout%252522%25252C%252522name%252522%25253A%252522group-2%252522%25252C%252522body%252522%25253A%252522%25253Cinline-embed%252520type%25253D%25255C%252522image%25255C%252522%252520meta%25253D%25255C%252522%2525257B% treets.%20In%20October%2C%202016%2C%20Iraqi%20security%20forces%20filmed%20themselves%20executing%20a%20captive%20in%20Qayyarah%2C%20an%20hour%20south%20of%20Mosul.%20They%20also%20tied%20the%20bodies%20of%20several%20dead%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20fighters%20to%20the%20back%20of%20a%20Nissan%20pickup%20truck%20and%20dragged%20them%20through%20Qayyarah%E2%80%99s%20main%20road%2C%20while%20villagers%20cheered%3B%20children%20kicked%20the%20corpses%2C%20and%20a%20man%20stood%20on%20one%20of%20the%20bodies%2C%20surfing.%20According%20to%20Human%20Rights%20Watch%2C%20which%20obtained%20thirteen%20videos%20from%20the%20scene%2C%20a%20man%20from%20a%20nearby%20village%20came%20to%20Qayyarah%20after%20hearing%20that%20the%20man%20who%20had%20killed%20his%20father%20and%20three%20of%20his%20uncles%20was%20among%20the%20dead%20fighters.%20He%20beheaded%20the%20man%20and%20cut%20out%20his%20heart%2C%20then%20presented%20it%20as%20a%20gift%20to%20his%20mother.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EElsewhere%20in%20Iraq%2C%20security%20forces%20filmed%20themselves%20punching%2C%20kicking%2C%20and%20whipping%20men%20in%20ad-hoc%20detention%20sites%2C%20including%20school%20classrooms.%20They%20dragged%20suspects%20by%20the%20hair%2C%20stepped%20on%20their%20heads%2C%20slammed%20knees%20into%20their%20faces%2C%20and%20threw%20furniture%20at%20them.%20They%20beat%20people%20unconscious%3B%20they%20beat%20people%20to%20death.%20They%20filmed%20themselves%20gunning%20down%20captives%20in%20open%20fields%20and%20stabbing%20them%20in%20the%20face%20with%20knives.%20A%20group%20of%20Hashd%20members%20struggled%20to%20interrogate%20six%20foreign%20fighters%20who%20couldn%E2%80%99t%20speak%20Arabic%3B%20in%20the%20end%2C%20they%20shot%20them%2C%20doused%20them%20in%20gasoline%2C%20and%20lit%20them%20on%20fire%E2%80%94including%20two%20who%20were%20still%20alive.%20A%20federal%20police%20officer%20filmed%20himself%20beheading%20captives%2C%20including%20minors%2C%20and%20posted%20the%20videos%20to%20his%20Facebook%20account.%20He%20told%20a%20Swedish%20reporter%20that%20he%20had%20decapitated%20fifty%20people%20so%20far%2C%20all%20while%20they%20were%20still%20alive%3B%20as%20he%20paraded%20through%20the%20streets%20holding%20severed%20heads%20aloft%2C%20other%20uniformed%20police%20officers%20and%20soldiers%20cheered%20and%20marched%20alongside%20him.%20All%20through%20northern%20and%20western%20Iraq%2C%20anti-%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20forces%20kept%20lists%20of%20people%20they%20wanted%20to%20kill.%20They%20hung%20bodies%20from%20telephone%20poles%2C%20and%20encouraged%20civilians%20to%20desecrate%20the%20corpses%20of%20their%20former%20jihadi%20oppressors.%20The%20irony%20was%20not%20lost%20on%20the%20killers%E2%80%94they%20knew%20that%20they%20were%20mirroring%20the%20Islamic%20State%E2%80%99s%20worst%20acts.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EThe%20Iraqi%20government%20has%20sought%20to%20minimize%20attention%20to%20such%20atrocities.%20Haider%20al-Abadi%2C%20who%20served%20as%20Prime%20Minister%20between%202014%20and%20October%2C%202018%2C%20dismissed%20them%20as%20%E2%80%9Cindividual%20acts%E2%80%9D%20for%20which%20the%20perpetrators%20would%20be%20held%20to%20account.%20But%20there%20have%20been%20no%20meaningful%20investigations.%20According%20to%20the%20senior%20Iraqi%20intelligence%20official%2C%20%E2%80%9Call%20Hashd%20violations%20are%20carried%20out%20with%20the%20knowledge%20and%20approval%20of%20the%20national-security%20apparatus%2C%20in%20all%20governorates.%E2%80%9D%20He%20added%20that%20the%20government%20has%20provided%20official%20cover%20for%20numerous%20civilian%20massacres%2C%20by%20organizing%20press%20conferences%20and%20lying%20about%20the%20provenance%20of%20mass%20graves.%20%E2%80%9CThe%20Iraqi%20government%20brought%20in%20journalists%20and%20said%2C%20%E2%80%98Look%2C%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20killed%20these%20civilians%2C%E2%80%99%20when%20in%20fact%20it%20was%20the%20Hashd%20al-Sha%E2%80%99abi%2C%E2%80%9D%20he%20said.%20%E2%80%9CThe%20reality%20is%20totally%20different%20from%20what%20ends%20up%20in%20the%20media.%20At%20least%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20had%20the%20courage%20to%20not%20hide%20its%20crimes.%E2%80%9D%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%22%7D","ref":""},["p","The war against the Islamic State displaced a million people in Nineveh Province. Civilians who had fled ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," at the outset, in 2014, were asked by Kurdish and Iraqi intelligence officers to inform on neighbors who had assisted the group. The names were then entered into databases of terrorism suspects, available to Iraqi security branches, including the Hashd militias. As the war dragged on, the lists became increasingly unreliable. People reported their enemies, and wielded the threat of denunciation in personal, tribal, and workplace disputes. “We have thousands of suspects in custody whose names were falsely reported, or are based on incorrect information, and they are treated as ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," members,” the senior Iraqi intelligence official told me. He said that some Hashd fighters ran an extortion racket, demanding thousands of dollars from civilians and adding their names to the terrorism database if they couldn’t pay."],["inline-embed",{"type":"callout","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22callout%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22feature-medium%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22callout%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522callout%2522%252C%2522name%2522%253A%2522group-2%2522%252C%2522body%2522%253A%2522%253Cinline-embed%2520type%253D%255C%2522image%255C%2522%2520meta%253D%255C%2522%25257B%252522type%252522%25253A%252522image%252522%25252C%252522url%252522%25253A%252522%25252Fphotos%25252F5c12cc9a180e7352ae16670d%252522%25252C%252522width%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25252C%252522height%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25252C%252522caption%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25257D%255C%2522%2520ref%253D%255C%25225c12cc9a180e7352ae16670d%255C%2522%253E%253C%252Finline-embed%253E%253Cinline-embed%2520type%253D%255C%2522image%255C%2522%2520meta%253D%255C%2522%25257B%252522type%252522%25253A%252522image%252522%25252C%252522url%252522%25253A%252522%25252Fphotos%25252F5c12cc9b9ec14d553b1ae855%252522%25252C%252522width%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25252C%252522height%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25252C%252522caption%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25257D%255C%2522%2520ref%253D%255C%25225c12cc9b9ec14d553b1ae855%255C%2522%253E%253C%252Finline-embed%253E%2522%252C%2522attrs%2522%253A%257B%257D%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%22%5C%22%3E%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22image%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522image%2522%252C%2522url%2522%253A%2522%252Fphotos%252F5c12cc9a180e7352ae16670d%2522%252C%2522width%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522height%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522caption%2522%253A%2522%2522%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%225c12cc9a180e7352ae16670d%5C%22%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22image%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522image%2522%252C%2522url%2522%253A%2522%252Fphotos%252F5c12cc9b9ec14d553b1ae855%2522%252C%2522width%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522height%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522caption%2522%253A%2522%2522%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%225c12cc9b9ec14d553b1ae855%5C%22%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%22%2C%22attrs%22%3A%7B%7D%7D","ref":""},["inline-embed",{"type":"callout","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22callout%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22group-2%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22image%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522image%2522%252C%2522url%2522%253A%2522%252Fphotos%252F5c12cc9a180e7352ae16670d%2522%252C%2522width%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522height%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522caption%2522%253A%2522%2522%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%225c12cc9a180e7352ae16670d%5C%22%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22image%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522image%2522%252C%2522url%2522%253A%2522%252Fphotos%252F5c12cc9b9ec14d553b1ae855%2522%252C%2522width%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522height%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522caption%2522%253A%2522%2522%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%225c12cc9b9ec14d553b1ae855%5C%22%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%22%2C%22attrs%22%3A%7B%7D%7D","ref":""},["inline-embed",{"type":"image","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22image%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22%2Fphotos%2F5c12cc9a180e7352ae16670d%22%2C%22width%22%3A%22%22%2C%22height%22%3A%22%22%2C%22caption%22%3A%22%22%7D","ref":"5c12cc9a180e7352ae16670d"}],["inline-embed",{"type":"image","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22image%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22%2Fphotos%2F5c12cc9b9ec14d553b1ae855%22%2C%22width%22%3A%22%22%2C%22height%22%3A%22%22%2C%22caption%22%3A%22%22%7D","ref":"5c12cc9b9ec14d553b1ae855"}]]],["p","To many members of the Iraqi security forces, all civilians who hadn’t fled ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," were suspicious. Some soldiers regarded beards as a marker of affiliation, even though the jihadis had punished men who shaved. Others, by contrast, singled out men who had recently shaved or cut their hair, believing that the men were trying to evade detection. Injuries, too, attracted accusations of complicity; how could anyone know whether people who had barely survived shelling and air strikes were targets or merely collateral?"],["p","As civilians marched out of Mosul, toward camps for the displaced, masked informants stood at checkpoints, pointing out individuals who, they claimed, had worked with the Islamic State. Some of the informants were children, but that didn’t matter in court—a suspect would never find out who had denounced him, or what was said."],["inline-embed",{"type":"callout","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22callout%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22inline-ad%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cp%3Eadvertisement%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%22%2C%22attrs%22%3A%7B%7D%7D","ref":""},["p","advertisement"]],["p","All suspects were supposed to be handed over to the counterterrorism services, for an in-depth security screening. In practice, however, many captives faced vigilante justice in the streets. In October, 2016, Iraqi security forces filmed themselves executing a captive in Qayyarah, an hour south of Mosul. They also tied the bodies of several dead ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," fighters to the back of a Nissan pickup truck and dragged them through Qayyarah’s main road, while villagers cheered; children kicked the corpses, and a man stood on one of the bodies, surfing. According to Human Rights Watch, which obtained thirteen videos from the scene, a man from a nearby village came to Qayyarah after hearing that the man who had killed his father and three of his uncles was among the dead fighters. He beheaded the man and cut out his heart, then presented it as a gift to his mother."],["p","Elsewhere in Iraq, security forces filmed themselves punching, kicking, and whipping men in ad-hoc detention sites, including school classrooms. They dragged suspects by the hair, stepped on their heads, slammed knees into their faces, and threw furniture at them. They beat people unconscious; they beat people to death. They filmed themselves gunning down captives in open fields and stabbing them in the face with knives. A group of Hashd members struggled to interrogate six foreign fighters who couldn’t speak Arabic; in the end, they shot them, doused them in gasoline, and lit them on fire—including two who were still alive. A federal police officer filmed himself beheading captives, including minors, and posted the videos to his Facebook account. He told a Swedish reporter that he had decapitated fifty people so far, all while they were still alive; as he paraded through the streets holding severed heads aloft, other uniformed police officers and soldiers cheered and marched alongside him. All through northern and western Iraq, anti-",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," forces kept lists of people they wanted to kill. They hung bodies from telephone poles, and encouraged civilians to desecrate the corpses of their former jihadi oppressors. The irony was not lost on the killers—they knew that they were mirroring the Islamic State’s worst acts."],["p","The Iraqi government has sought to minimize attention to such atrocities. Haider al-Abadi, who served as Prime Minister between 2014 and October, 2018, dismissed them as “individual acts” for which the perpetrators would be held to account. But there have been no meaningful investigations. According to the senior Iraqi intelligence official, “all Hashd violations are carried out with the knowledge and approval of the national-security apparatus, in all governorates.” He added that the government has provided official cover for numerous civilian massacres, by organizing press conferences and lying about the provenance of mass graves. “The Iraqi government brought in journalists and said, ‘Look, ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," killed these civilians,’ when in fact it was the Hashd al-Sha’abi,” he said. “The reality is totally different from what ends up in the media. At least ",["em",{"class":"small"},"ISIS"]," had the courage to not hide its crimes.”"]],["inline-embed",{"type":"section","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22section%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cp%3ESuspects%20who%20survived%20their%20capture%20were%20taken%20to%20detention%20facilities%20in%20and%20around%20Mosul.%20Iraqi%20law%20stipulates%20that%20suspects%20must%20be%20brought%20before%20an%20investigative%20judge%20within%20twenty-four%20hours%20of%20arrest%2C%20but%20many%20people%20languished%20in%20custody%20for%20months.%20Although%20there%20were%20only%20around%20eight%20thousand%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20fighters%20living%20in%20Mosul%2C%20and%20far%20fewer%20in%20the%20surrounding%20villages%2C%20the%20lists%20of%20wanted%20people%20grew%20to%20some%20hundred%20thousand%20names.%20Dank%2C%20windowless%20cells%20held%20a%20hundred%20or%20more%20detainees%20each.%20Some%20facilities%20had%20no%20budget%20for%20food.%20Injuries%20that%20had%20been%20incurred%20on%20the%20battlefield%2C%20or%20during%20interrogation%20sessions%2C%20grew%20infected%20and%20gangrenous.%20Amputations%20were%20common%2C%20and%20detainees%20routinely%20died%20of%20suffocation%20or%20disease.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22callout%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522callout%2522%252C%2522name%2522%253A%2522feature-xsmall%2522%252C%2522body%2522%253A%2522%253Cinline-embed%2520type%253D%255C%2522image%255C%2522%2520meta%253D%255C%2522%25257B%252522type%252522%25253A%252522image%252522%25252C%252522url%252522%25253A%252522%25252Fphotos%25252F5c12cc9a2eb5b760bfa5e876%252522%25252C%252522width%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25252C%252522height%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25252C%252522caption%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25257D%255C%2522%2520ref%253D%255C%25225c12cc9a2eb5b760bfa5e876%255C%2522%253E%253C%252Finline-embed%253E%2522%252C%2522attrs%2522%253A%257B%257D%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%22%5C%22%3E%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22image%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522image%2522%252C%2522url%2522%253A%2522%252Fphotos%252F5c12cc9a2eb5b760bfa5e876%2522%252C%2522width%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522height%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522caption%2522%253A%2522%2522%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%225c12cc9a2eb5b760bfa5e876%5C%22%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22callout%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522callout%2522%252C%2522name%2522%253A%2522inline-ad%2522%252C%2522body%2522%253A%2522%253Cp%253Eadvertisement%253C%252Fp%253E%255Cn%2522%252C%2522attrs%2522%253A%257B%257D%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%22%5C%22%3E%3Cp%3Eadvertisement%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%3Cp%3E%E2%80%9CHundreds%20of%20innocent%20people%20have%20been%20detained%20because%20their%20names%20are%20similar%20to%20those%20of%20wanted%20people%2C%20and%20the%20state%20is%20doing%20nothing%20to%20solve%20this%2C%E2%80%9D%20the%20senior%20Iraqi%20intelligence%20official%20told%20me.%20(Mohammad%20is%20thought%20to%20be%20the%20most%20common%20name%20in%20the%20world.)%20Others%20are%20held%20on%20the%20basis%20of%20uncontrollable%20facts%20of%20identity%3A%20the%20suspect%20was%20a%20Sunni%20male%20of%20fighting%20age%2C%20from%20a%20village%20where%20the%20jihadis%20enjoyed%20widespread%20toleration%20or%20support%3B%20the%20suspect%20was%20the%20wife%2C%20father%2C%20brother%2C%20or%20cousin%20of%20a%20fighter%3B%20the%20suspect%20was%20a%20member%20of%20a%20rural%20tribe%20whose%20leader%20had%20pledged%20fealty%20to%20Abu%20Bakr%20al-Baghdadi.%20If%20someone%20is%20found%20innocent%20and%20released%2C%20no%20letter%20is%20sent%20to%20the%20entire%20security%20establishment%20to%20clear%20his%20name.%20%E2%80%9CHe%20might%20be%20arrested%20again%2C%20and%20this%20time%20not%20get%20released%2C%E2%80%9D%20the%20official%20said.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EIn%20late%20August%2C%20I%20met%20a%20seventeen-year-old%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20fighter%20inside%20a%20facility%20in%20Iraqi%20Kurdistan%20that%20is%20holding%20dozens%20of%20minors%20who%20have%20been%20convicted%20of%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E-related%20crimes.%20His%20name%20was%20Noor%2C%20and%2C%20along%20with%20another%20teen-ager%2C%20named%20Ahmad%2C%20he%20volunteered%20for%20an%20interview.%20In%20April%2C%202016%2C%20when%20Noor%20was%20fourteen%2C%20one%20of%20his%20friends%20recruited%20him%20to%20attend%20an%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20training%20camp.%20He%20wouldn%E2%80%99t%20specify%20what%20attracted%20him%20to%20the%20Islamic%20State%2C%20saying%20only%2C%20%E2%80%9CIf%20there%20was%20something%20I%20didn%E2%80%99t%20like%20about%20the%20group%2C%20I%20would%20not%20have%20joined.%E2%80%9D%20That%20October%2C%20he%20was%20captured%20by%20Kurdish%20forces%20near%20the%20town%20of%20Bashiqa%2C%20dressed%20like%20a%20member%20of%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%2C%20with%20long%20sleeves%20and%20pants%20stopping%20above%20the%20ankles%2C%20and%20carrying%20a%20Kalashnikov.%20Noor%20was%20the%20only%20jihadi%20in%20his%20family%E2%80%94he%20told%20me%20that%20he%20had%20joined%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E%20without%20his%20parents%E2%80%99%20knowledge%20or%20permission%E2%80%94but%2C%20last%20year%2C%20members%20of%20a%20Hashd%20group%20arrested%20his%20relatives%2C%20expropriated%20their%20home%20and%20property%2C%20and%20sent%20them%20to%20detention%20camps.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EAs%20Noor%20spoke%2C%20Ahmad%20looked%20uncomfortable.%20He%20said%20that%20he%20wanted%20to%20talk%2C%20but%20not%20with%20Noor%20in%20the%20room.%20A%20prison%20worker%20escorted%20Noor%20back%20to%20his%20cell.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3E%E2%80%9CI%E2%80%99ve%20been%20here%20for%20two%20years%20and%20eight%20months%2C%20trapped%20with%20all%20these%20jihadi%20kids!%E2%80%9D%20Ahmad%20said%20in%20a%20rush.%20%E2%80%9CBut%20I%E2%80%99m%20not%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3EISIS%3C%2Fem%3E!%20They%20picked%20me%20up%20by%20mistake!%E2%80%9D%20One%20of%20his%20cou
